author: Staff Reporter
text:
Principal District Judge S. Ramathilagam on Thursday dismissed the bail application of S. Yuvaraj, the prime accused in the murder of Dalit youth V. Gokulraj.

When the petition came up for hearing, Public Prosecutor Ramesh said that nine cases were pending against Yuvaraj and provisions under the Goondas Act have been invoked against him.

If he was released on bail, he may threaten witnesses. Yuvaraj’s lawyer R. Krishnan said that there was no evidence against him, and hence should be released on bail.

It is for the second time that the bail petition of the founder of Theeran Chinnamalai Gounder Peravai was being dismissed.

On December 7, the judge had dismissed the bail petition field by Yuvaraj.

Yuvaraj’s lawyer said that Madras High Court would be moved seeking bail. Yuvaraj is lodged at Vellore Central Prison.

The CB-CID had on January 7 filed a 725-page charge sheet, naming 17 people as accused in the Gokulraj murder case.
title: Bail plea of Yuvaraj dismissed again; to move High Court
